meanings.definition: The quality or state of being malevolent.
meanings.sent1: Her malevolences towards her classmates were evident in her sneaky pranks.
meanings.sent2: The detective sensed the malevolences behind the mysterious disappearances.
meanings.sent3: The cat's malevolences towards the mouse were comically obvious as it tried to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The malevolences of the storm caused chaos and destruction in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The malevolences lurking in the shadows made the old house seem haunted.

meanings.sent1: The villain's malevolences were clear as he plotted his evil scheme.
meanings.sent2: The soldier could sense the enemy's malevolences as they approached.
meanings.sent3: The malevolences of the grumpy neighbor were evident in his constant scowls.
meanings.sent4: The malevolences in her eyes sent a chill down his spine.
meanings.sent5: The malevolences in his tone made it clear he was not to be trusted.

meanings.sent1: The malevolences of the dark magic corrupted the once peaceful kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The malevolences of the toxic relationship were toxic to her well-being.
meanings.sent3: The malevolences of the cursed amulet brought misfortune to all who possessed it.
meanings.sent4: The malevolences of greed can lead people down a dangerous path.
meanings.sent5: The malevolences of the haunted forest whispered in the wind, warning travelers to stay away.
